required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of SARS-CoV2 Urine Viral Particles and Association With Proximal Tubular Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: Molecular Characterization and Cellular Infection Capacity of Urinary Viral Particles Isolated From SARS-CoV-2 and Association With Proximal Tubular Dysfunction, in Hospitalized Patients With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goal is to detect Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome CoronaVirus 2 (SARS-CoV2) urine viral particles in patients in intensive care units, hospitalized for coronavirus Coronavirus Disease-19 (COVID-19) infection, and correlate the presence of the virus in the urine with proximal tubular dysfunction (defined by the association of at least 2 abnormalities: tubular proteinuria, renal phosphate leak, uricosuria, normoglycemic glycosuria, amino aciduria)

primary_outcome.measure: SARS-CoV 2 viruria and its correlation with proximal tubule dysfunction
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 10 days of hospitalization
primary_outcome.description: Is the detection of viral particles in urine associated with proximal tubule dysfunction, defined by two or more of the following : proteinuria, phosphate leak, aminoaciduria, hyperuricuria, and/or glycosuria

secondary_outcome.measure: Capacity of infection of urine viral particles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 10 days of hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Study of the capacity for cell infection in vitro by viral particles detected in urine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sequencing viral particles to identify possible compartmentalization of the virus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 10 days of hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Study by sequencing of the compartmentalization of urinary and nasopharyngeal variants of SARS-CoV-2 in patients with positive urine for SARS-CoV-2.

biospec_descr.textblock: Reverse Transcriptase -Polymerase Chain Reaction (RT-PCR) for SARS-CoV2 in urine

study_pop.textblock: Patients hospitalized in CHRU Nancy with severe SARS-CoV2 infection, with lung involvement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Person and / or trustworthy person who has received complete information on the organization of the research and who has not opposed their participation and the use of their data
- Hospitalized for ≥ 48 hours and ≤ 10 days
- SARS-CoV-2 positive nasopharyngeal sample
- Severity criteria: Lung involvement described as compatible with SARS-CoV-2 on radiography or scanner and partial pressure of oxygne (PaO2) / Fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) ≤ 300 mmHg and / or respiratory rate (RR) ≥ 30 / min
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known chronic kidney disease, or initial Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) <60 ml / min / 1.73m2 or Renal Transplant
- Known proteinuria
- Known proximal tubulopathy
- Treatment with Forxiga

reference.citation: Kormann R, Jacquot A, Alla A, Corbel A, Koszutski M, Voirin P, Garcia Parrilla M, Bevilacqua S, Schvoerer E, Gueant JL, Namour F, Levy B, Frimat L, Oussalah A. Coronavirus disease 2019: acute Fanconi syndrome precedes acute kidney injury. Clin Kidney J. 2020 Jun 8;13(3):362-370. doi: 10.1093/ckj/sfaa109. eCollection 2020 Jun.
